Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulator

  • class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulate a simulation. A simulator object maintains a priority queue of events, and repeatedly process the events in the queue until the time is up. We can schedule an event in the simulator with the @code{add} method, and run the simulator with the @code{run} method.

    A simulator object interacts with Event objects and Simulation object, both handles the actual system that is being simulated.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  Simulator.Params
      Params is a private container class for all configuration parameters of this simulation.
      (package private) class  Simulator.Statistic
      Statistics is a private container class for all statistics collected wrt to this this simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Initialize the parameters and the states of the simulation.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line argument. If none is given, read from standard input. Else, assume args[0] is the input filename, and read from that file.

    • Method Detail

      • exponentialValue

        private double exponentialValue​(double rate)
        Helper method to generate a random value by passing a parameter to a logarithm algorithm.
        Parameters:
        rate - Variable modifier for generated values.
        Returns:
        a generated logarithmic value.

      • generateArrivalTime

        private double generateArrivalTime​()
        Generate a random inter-arrival time according to exponential distribution with average arrival rate lambda.
        Returns:
        the randomly generated inter-arrival time.

      • generateServiceTime

        private double generateServiceTime​()
        Generate a random service time according to exponential distribution with average service time mu.
        Returns:
        the randomly generated service time.

      • generateBreakTime

        private double generateBreakTime​()
        Generate a random break time according to exponential distribution with parameter break time.
        Returns:
        the randomly generated break time.

      • generateSwitchTime

        private double generateSwitchTime​()
        Generate a random time between switch events according to exponential distribution with parameter switch time.
        Returns:
        the randomly generated time between switch events.

      • generateCustomer

        public Customer generateCustomer​()
        Generate one of three type of customers: Pioneer, Typical or Kiasu based on parameters pP and pK, where pP denotes the chance a Pioneer customer will be generated and pK denotes the chance a Kiasu customer will be generated. Else, a typical customer is generated instead.
        Returns:
        a customer of one of three types: Pioneer, Typical or Kiasu.

      • generateBreakChance

        public boolean generateBreakChance​()
        Generate one of three type of customers: Pioneer, Typical or Kiasu based on parameters pP and pK, where pP denotes the chance a Pioneer customer will be generated and pK denotes the chance a Kiasu customer will be generated. Else, a typical customer is generated instead.
        Returns:
        a customer of one of three types: Pioneer, Typical or Kiasu.

      • generateArrival

        public Event generateArrival​()
        Generate the next random arrival event with a customer requring a random service time.
        Returns:
        the new arrival event.

      • generateDone

        public Event generateDone​(Customer c,
                          Server s)
        Generate a "done" event indicating that the given server has completed service to the given customer. The service time is determined by the customer.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer served
        s - the server who serves the custoner.
        Returns:
        the new done event.

      • generateServe

        public Event generateServe​(Customer c,
                           Server s)
        Generate a service event at the current time to signal that the customer is now being served by the server.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer being served.
        s - the server serving the customer.
        Returns:
        the new serve event.

      • generateBreak

        public Event generateBreak​(Server s)
        Generate a break event at the current time to signal that the current server is going on break after a done event.
        Parameters:
        s - the server going for break.
        Returns:
        the new break event.

      • generateResume

        public Event generateResume​(Server s)
        Generate a resume event after server returns from break from random given break time.
        Parameters:
        s - the server returning from break
        Returns:
        the new resume event.

      • generateSwitch

        public Event generateSwitch​(Customer c)
        Generate a time between switch event for each customer not being served immediately. Switch events are generated atomically for each individual customers until they are served.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer switching queues.
        Returns:
        the new switch event.

      • recordCustomerServed

        public void recordCustomerServed​(double time)
        Record the waiting time of a customer.
        Parameters:
        time - The time a customer spent waiting (could be 0)

      • firstEvents

        public Event[] firstEvents​()
        Return the first set of events to the simulator to kick-start the simulator.
        Returns:
        An array of initial events to populate the simualtor with.

      • schedule

        public void schedule​(Event[] events)
        Schedule a set of events in the simulator so that it is executed later.
        Parameters:
        events - The event to be simulated.

      • handle

        public Event[] handle​(Event e)
        Simulate the occurance of a given event. More events may be created as a result of this event. The new events are returned in an array. If the curren simulation time is already beyond the expired time, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        e - The event to simulate.
        Returns:
        An array of new events created as a result of simulating this event.

      • run

        public void run​()
        Run the simulator. The simulator keeps polling the next event from the event list, passes the event to the simulation to handle, until the simulation expires(regulated by simTime). Finally, the simulator prints out the stats.
